page.title: 13AUCHINSTARRY QUARRY
page.content:
At Auchinstarry there is a disused quarry. Skilled quarrymen worked the stone into sets,kerbs and paving stones which were then taken by barge down the canal to pave the streets of Glasgow.
Now it is a good place to go to spend the day. There are two pools in which you can swim. Smaller children go into the little pool. Some people dive off the rocks or the bridge. Lots of people like to sunbathe there if it is hot. Climbers can often be seen scaling the quarry sides, where nearly 100 feet of whin is exposed. There are tables and benches for picnickers too.
